page.title: 16 Methil Docks
page.content: Methil main trade for generations was the export of coal from local coalpits initially owned by the Laird of Wemyss He was responsible for the development of the docks in 1869.The docks were then bought by North British Rail Co in 1889 but since 1968 they have been handled by the Fife Ports Authority. The coal exports have declined,the main export is now scrap metal.Imports are timber,wood pulp for the paper mills,grain and fertiliser which go to Central Farmers(a co_operative set up by Fife and Tayside Region).Important too is steel imported to manufacture the steel jackets and platform decks made at nearby R.G.C. offshore fabrication yard. The Forth is a sheltered deep water estuary and tankers and oil rigs use Methil as a service base and to do repairs.
